channel.title: Comments on: My PASS Summit Packing List
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Mickey Stuewe
item.dc:creator: Mickey Stuewe
item.description: Don't overstuff your suitcase on the way to the conference. There are always goodies/gifts to bring home.
item.content:encoded: Don’t overstuff your suitcase on the way to the conference. There are always goodies/gifts to bring home.

item.title: By: Dugi
item.dc:creator: Dugi
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy your trip and your stay ASAP!
All the best!
@DugiDBA

item.title: By: Craig Purnell
item.dc:creator: Craig Purnell
item.description: If you wear contacts, don't forget to bring your eyeglasses. The convention center tends to dry out your eyes rapidly. I usually swap out in the late afternoon.
item.content:encoded: If you wear contacts, don’t forget to bring your eyeglasses. The convention center tends to dry out your eyes rapidly. I usually swap out in the late afternoon.

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: "Emergen-C or Airborne or something â€“ the nerd flu has a habit of making the rounds."<br /> Good advice - I left SQL Saturday #118 with a vast storehouse of knowledge, and Whooping Cough );
item.content:encoded:
“Emergen-C or Airborne or something â€“ the nerd flu has a habit of making the rounds.”
Good advice – I left SQL Saturday #118 with a vast storehouse of knowledge, and Whooping Cough );

item.title: By: Rob Farley
item.dc:creator: Rob Farley
item.content:encoded:
Non-Americans will need their passports too. Some venues won’t accept foreign drivers’ licenses and will refuse admission even if you look fifty (as many thirty-somethings do after a few days of Summit).

And thanks for the mention. ðŸ™‚
